intro: Timonius bosaviensis, commonly known as the Bosavi timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has a woody stem with hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
